title: Women's March brings large crowd despite rain
description: The Women's March at Sawyer Park in Cincinnati, Ohio, hosted by United We Stand, Saturday, Jan. 18, 2020. The march started after President Donald Trump was inaugurated on January 20, 2017 to support women's policies and rights.
text_headers: Women's March brings large crowd despite rain
text: Women's March brings large crowd despite rainLocal News Sports Opinion For Subscribers NKY Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals NEWSWomen's March brings large crowd despite rain Liz Dufourldufour@enquirer.comEleanor Towe, 8, of Madeira, with her mom, Ariana, walk during the Women's March at Sawyer Park in Cincinnati, Ohio, hosted by United We Stand, Saturday, Jan. 18, 2020. The Women's March started the day after President Donald Trump was inaugurated on January 20, 2017. The movement supports women's policies, immigration reform, reproductive rights, LGBTQ rights, racial equality, freedom of religion, workers' rights and tolerance.Liz Dufour/The EnquirerOlivia Berke, 15, a sophomore at Walnut Hills High School, attends the Women's March at Sawyer Park in Cincinnati, Ohio, hosted by United We Stand, Saturday, Jan. 18, 2020. The Women's March started the day after President Donald Trump was inaugurated on January 20, 2017. The movement supports women's policies, immigration reform, reproductive rights, LGBTQ rights, racial equality, freedom of religion, workers' rights and tolerance.Liz Dufour/The EnquirerA large crowd takes part in the Women's March at Sawyer Park in Cincinnati, Ohio, hosted by United We Stand, Saturday, Jan. 18, 2020. The walk took by The Banks, along the Ohio River. The Women's March started the day after President Donald Trump was inaugurated on January 20, 2017. The movement supports women's policies, immigration reform, reproductive rights, LGBTQ rights, racial equality, freedom of religion, workers' rights and tolerance.Liz Dufour/The EnquirerSydney Jeffrie, 5, of Westwood, carries a sign during the Women's March at Sawyer Park in Cincinnati, Ohio, hosted by United We Stand, Saturday, Jan. 18, 2020.
